title: dotted sans - does anyone know what typeface this is please?
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025052626im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/la_logo_white_5130.jpg)

Hi does anyone know what the name of this typeface? i posted it a while ago but nobody seemed to be able to help....

thankyou!

 [‹ To Find: A Substitute For Lacuna and FF Good Wide Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025052626/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49670 "Go to previous forum topic") [font id help ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025052626/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49665 "Go to next forum topic")
author: commonprojects

comments.content:
i cannot really tell exactly what font this might be, but an alternative would be “National First”

another dotted font I personally love is “Fortuna Dot” which you can find it here [http://simplythebest.net/fonts/fonts/fortunadot.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025052626/http:/simplythebest.net/fonts/fonts/fortunadot.html "http://simplythebest.net/fonts/fonts/fortunadot.html"), it isn’t anything like the one you are looking for, but still worth checking out :)

cheers
Support type designers. License their type. :^) Fortuna Dot is [here at Font Bros.](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025052626/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=HAFO-FODO)
hmmm second post and still no body seems to know..... someone must know what that typeface is??

It looks like Avant Garde reworked with dots.

ChrisL

Chris, [Avant Garde Gothic extra light](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025052626/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-avant-garde-gothic/xlt/) is slightly different in the details of the letterforms, but certainly what you suggest will get much closer than the previous suggestions.

- Mike Yanega

i have found out that build digitised it specially for the flying lotus cover based on the letraset version of pinball - so that means for now just bespoke unless they are plan to release. thankyou to everyone thats helped with this : )
